author: potuz
content: If you get devnet eth you can do whatever you want with it, so you can deposit and become a validator if you want.

author: potuz
content: There aren't public faucets other than begging pari, Barnabas or Marius that are rich for it

author: potuz
content: I take that back. There's s very public faucet looking for the right keywords in this Discord server üôÇ

author: samlafer
content: Sorry my phrasing probably confused me. I meant the recent devnets created to test the capella withdrawal capabilities (changing withdrawal credentials, getting partial rewards to EL, etc)

author: samlafer
content: Like are those devnets themselves public? Or are they created only internally between EF members to test functionality

author: potuz
content: Yeah those, you can run a non validating node, the information is public. What's not available is official support from clients. If you want to run validators you will need to ask for devnet eth and cook up deposits

author: potuz
content: I'm assuming <@412614104222531604> embedded a deposit contract in the last devnet genesis though

author: samlafer
content: Ah I see! Thanks a bunch. We would love to be able to test certain withdrawal functionalities at Eigenlayer. <@412614104222531604> any chance Santa faucet could point our way?
